title: X Factor's Megan McKenna is the next Kylie Minogue, says Pete Waterman
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Megan McKenna is hoping that iconic music producer Pete Waterman will help her become the next Kylie Minogue following an appearance on The X Factor: Celebrity.

The pair made an appearance on Good Morning Britain on Tuesday after the premiere of Simon Cowell’s revamped singing competition which will see the likes of a Love Island supergroup go up against Martin Bashir.

Pete – also known as the Hitman – has been called on by the music mogul to help out for the show after his huge success in the 1980s as part of Stock, Aitken and Waterman who launched the careers of the likes of Kylie Minogue and Rick Astley.

When asked if Megan can be the next Kylie, Pete told Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid: ‘Absolutely, she’s brilliant, she’s fantastic.’

Megan has previously auditioned for The X Factor several times (Picture; Rex)

Megan has previously auditioned for The X Factor several times, but she said ‘the pressure is crazy’ and she felt the ‘comments were quite harsh but there is big competition’.

Megan has been a country singer in the making for a few years now, knocking music icon Dolly Parton off the top of the iTunes country charts with her debut album Story Of Me, and opening the main stage for Michael Buble at British Summer Time in Hyde Park in 2019.

‘It is [tougher now],’ added Pete, ‘but you’ve still got to have a great song, and have a great performance, and what I like about this whole idea is they are out of their comfort zone, and you will some fantastic performances from people that shock you.’

‘Max and Harvey are strong, they are really good,’ added Megan.

The X Factor: Celebrity airs on Saturday on ITV at 8.35pm.
